item.description:
"Volunteering: doing small things that leaves big impact"

 

Volunteers!  Let's roll up our sleeves and help in the kitchen of Community Servings!

While in their kitchen, we, the volunteers, could be doing any number of things, including:

- Packaging desserts

- Cutting up meats and vegetables

- Ladling soups

- Preparing cereal bags

- Working the food assembly line (scooping food into a container and passing it along)

- Helping clean the kitchen and kitchen equipment

- Washing fruits and vegetables

 

 

Health and Wellness Policy

You will be helping to prepare and package meals for our critically-ill neighbors who have weakened immune systems. Safe food handling, sanitation and wellness are top priority. All members of the team who are volunteering need to be 100% healthy. You CANNOT volunteer in the kitchen if you have experienced a fever, diarrhea, a persistent cough or runny nose in the last 24 hours.

 

Dress Code Policy

Please come in comfortable clothes and shoes. Everyone needs to wear either pants or a long skirt, shoes that cover and protect the feet and a shirt that has at least a t-shirt length sleeve. Your head will need to be covered. You can bring a baseball hat or Community Servings will provide a hairnet. An apron will be provided but spills and stains can happen. Remember, if you are not dressed appropriately you will not be able to volunteer!

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Roll Up Your Sleeves and Help at the Kitchen of Community Servings!
